page.title: 14THE CHURCH AND CHAPEL
page.content: The{church}in this area is led by a retired vicar the Rev P Ralph-Bowman. He looks after Bryngwyn and Llanbedr churches amongst others. The problems of such churches are common to all country churches - the oppressive cost of maintaining the building and falling rolls - on the average only 8 people go to each service. The{chapel}- there is one in Rhosgoch and one in Painscastle - is optomistic . There buildings are simpler and often maintained by members of the congregation, each person giving his or her skills quite unstintingly.
